snippet: In what may be his last, most sweeping effort to effect change in America, the president will roll out his plan to tackle climate change.
abstract: Pres Obama, in what may be his last, most sweeping effort to remake America in his time in office, will roll out plan to tackle climate change; high stakes are involved in his move, using executive powers to slash carbon emissions by coal-fired power plants in United States without approval from Congress.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and CORAL DAVENPORT

lead_paragraph: In what may be his last, most sweeping effort to effect change in America, the president will roll out his plan to tackle climate change.

headline.main: Using Executive Powers, Obama Begins His Last Big Push on Climate Policy
headline.print_headline: Using Executive Powers, Obama Begins His Last Big Push on Climate Policy
